titles.title: Alien Unaccompanied Minor Adjustment and Protection Act of 2000

To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide for the adjustment of status of certain unaccompanied alien children and the establishment of a panel of advisors to assist unaccompanied alien children in immigration proceedings.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 5/2/2000--Introduced. Alien Unaccompanied Minor Adjustment and Protection Act of 2000 - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to authorize the Attorney General to adjust the status of certain unaccompanied aliens under 18 years old to permanent resident.Directs the Attorney General to provide for the establishment outside the Immigration and Naturalization Service (INS) of a panel of advisors to serve as guardians ad litem for such aliens in related INS proceedings.
